com.matrix.util

Interface Matrix<T extends java.lang.Number>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMatrix, ArrayMatrix, SparseMatrix, TreeSparseMatrix

    public interface Matrix<T extends java.lang.Number>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Matrix<T> add(Matrix<T> m)
      Add the argument matrix to this and return a new matrix containing the result.
      T getElement(int row, int column)
      Return the element at position (row,column).
      int getNumberOfColumns()
      Return the number of columns in the matrix.
      int getNumberOfRows()
      Return the number of rows in the matrix.
      Matrix<T> multiply(Matrix<T> m)
      Multiply the argument matrix with this and return a new matrix containing the result.
      void setElement(int row, int column, T value)
      Set element at position (row,column).
      Matrix<T> subtract(Matrix<T> m)
      Subtract the argument matrix from this and return a new matrix containing the result.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfRows

        int getNumberOfRows()
        Return the number of rows in the matrix.
        Returns:
        the number of rows in the matrix.

      • getNumberOfColumns

        int getNumberOfColumns()
        Return the number of columns in the matrix.
        Returns:
        the number of columns in the matrix.

      • getElement

        T getElement(int row,
             int column)
      throws MatrixException
        Return the element at position (row,column).
        Parameters:
        row - row of element to return.
        column - column of element to return.
        Returns:
        element value of element.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if the element position is not within the matrix.

      • setElement

        void setElement(int row,
                int column,
                T value)
         throws MatrixException
        Set element at position (row,column). If the element is not within the matrix, the matrix is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        row - row of element to set.
        column - column of element to set.
        value - value to store at (row,column).
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if the element position is not within the matrix.

      • add

        Matrix<T> add(Matrix<T> m)
       throws MatrixException
        Add the argument matrix to this and return a new matrix containing the result. The matrices must match in size for the addition to succeed. This is a generic method that can add matrices of any concrete implementation class.
        Parameters:
        m - matrix to add to this.
        Returns:
        new matrix containing the result or null.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if parameter matrix is not the same size as the matrix the method is called for.

      • subtract

        Matrix<T> subtract(Matrix<T> m)
            throws MatrixException
        Subtract the argument matrix from this and return a new matrix containing the result. The matrices must match in size for the subtraction to succeed. This is a generic method that can subtract matrices of any concrete implementation class.
        Parameters:
        m - matrix to subtract from this.
        Returns:
        new matrix containing the result or null.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if parameter matrix is not the same size as the matrix the method is called for.

      • multiply

        Matrix<T> multiply(Matrix<T> m)
            throws MatrixException
        Multiply the argument matrix with this and return a new matrix containing the result. The matrices must have valid sizes for the multiplication to succeed. This is a generic method that can multiply matrices of any concrete implementation class.
        Parameters:
        m - matrix to multiply with this.
        Returns:
        new matrix containing the result or null.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if matrices are not of compatible size to perform multiplication.
